@Vlad Korobov another question for you! :)

In dark mode, the search box hover does box shadow

box-shadow: 0 4px 20px hsl(0deg 0% 0% / 30%),
                0 1px 5px hsl(0deg 0% 0% / 30%);

in light mode it's

box-shadow: 0 4px 20px hsl(0deg 0% 0% / 15%),
                0 1px 5px hsl(0deg 0% 0% / 10%);

Would it be possible to make the light mode one have the two colors be the same, the way it is in dark mode?

sure, you can decrease 15 to be 10:

box-shadow: 0 4px 20px hsl(0deg 0% 0% / 10%),
                0 1px 5px hsl(0deg 0% 0% / 10%);

Vlad said:

If I'm focused in the field and hit Tab it just closes the input. Should it be so? Right now it acts like Enter key

and I responded:

Tab acting like enter key doesn't make that much sense to me, so I prefer the way it works in this PR. Thanks for noticing it changed though -- would you prefer tab acting like enter?
My understand is the assumed functionality of tab is to switch focus to another part of the page, not to perform an action. This is how it works for most buttons, for example.

@Vlad Korobov can you confirm what you'd like?

And also wanted to see if other folks on CZO had opinions on this.
Agreed that tab should switch focus.
Switch focus and also not activate search? (i.e. I'm double checking that tab shouldn't cause a search to happen on what's currently written in the search box)

It seems like poor form for Tab to initiate any action like that. But since initiating the search is what the search box does currently, so I wonder if it would be a problem to change it? Still, in that situation, I would hit Return, not Tab
Return does cause the search action to happen.
So I don't think it would be a problem? But wanted to run it by people just in case
The only thing I was expecting from Tab is to focus on X button to clear the input

I thought there is no need in highlighting that input that strong. Icons feel comfortable being on dark background. We just increase the feeling of icon with text here. The intention is to not make you feel like you know where the edges are but increase the contrast under the search word and icon... but if its annoying lets do this trick:

box-shadow: 0 0px 2px var(--color-search-box-hover-shadow);

image.png
I think in my example I applied it to a wrong element but this is an idea of a border... which will be slightly visible
